00001 #pragma once

00003 using namespace System;
00004 
00005 /** \class  Unit
00006 *  Unit class for Units API. Original by Gareth Charnock. 
00007 *  The general approach to units of a quantity is stored in a
00008 *  double, then that quantity is in SI. Quantities stored in a double or
00009 *  dimension double can be stored as a user defined unit type. Assigning
00010 *  or implicitly converting a double to a double should result in an SI
00011 *  quantity being assigned to the double (and visa versa with the custom
00012 *  unit type being assigned to the double)
00013 */
00014 public ref class Unit {
00015 public:
00016         /**
00017         * @brief Constructor for unit.
00018         * @param name Name of unit.
00019         * @param toSIf Multiply factor to convert to SI units.
00020         */
00021         Unit(String^ name, double toSIf) : mName(name), mToSI(toSIf),mFromSI(1.0f/mToSI) {};
00022 
00023         /**
00024         * @brief Getter for name.
00025         * @result Returns the name as string.
00026         */
00027         String^  get_name(){return mName;}
00028 
00029         /**
00030         * @brief Operator for when converted to string, returns the name.
00031         * @result Returns the name as string.
00032         */
00033         inline operator const String ^ () {return mName;}
00034 
00035         /**
00036         * @brief Function for convertin from non SI units(this one) to SI units.
00037         * @param nonSI Value in non SI unit(this one).
00038         * @result Returns the value in SI unit.
00039         */
00040         inline double toSI(double nonSI)  {return mToSI*nonSI;}
00041 
00042         /**
00043         * @brief Function for convertin from SI units to non SI units(this one).
00044         * @param SI Value in  SI unit.
00045         * @result Returns the value in non SI unit(this one).
00046         */
00047         inline double fromSI(double SI)  {return mFromSI*SI;}
00048 
00049         /**
00050         * @brief Getter for factor to SI units.
00051         * @result Returns the factor to SI units.
00052         */
00053         inline double get_to_si()  {return mToSI;}
00054 
00055         /**
00056         * @brief Getter for factor from SI units.
00057         * @result Returns the factorfrom SI units.
00058         */
00059         inline double get_from_si()  {return mFromSI;}
00060 
00061 private:
00062         String^ mName;   ///< String name of the unit
00063         double mToSI;    ///< Factor to convert to SI units
00064         double mFromSI;  ///< Factor to convert from SI units
00065 };
00066 
00067 
00068 
00069 /** \class  Units
00070 * Collection of static units classes where there defined spesicific units
00071 */
00072 public ref class Units  
00073 {
00074 public:
00075 
00076         //Unknown units
00077         static Unit^ Unitless = gcnew Unit(L"Unitless",1.0f);
00078         static Unit^ Unknown= gcnew Unit(L"Unknown",1.0f);
00079 
00080         //Magnetic fluc
00081         static Unit^ Gauss = gcnew Unit(L"Gauss",1.0f);
00082         static Unit^ mTesla = gcnew Unit(L"mTesla",10.0f);
00083         static Unit^ Mi_b = gcnew Unit(L"Bohr magneton",1.0f);
00084         static Unit^ ppm = gcnew Unit(L"ppm",1.0f);
00085 
00086         //Energy
00087         static Unit^ Joule = gcnew Unit("Joule",1.0);
00088         static Unit^ Hz = gcnew Unit("Hz",6.626068e-34);
00089         static Unit^ rev_cm = gcnew Unit("cm^-1",1.9863e-23);
00090         static Unit^ KHz = gcnew Unit("KHz",6.626068e-31);
00091         static Unit^ MHz = gcnew Unit("MHz",6.626068e-28);
00092         static Unit^ GHz = gcnew Unit("GHz",6.626068e-25);
00093         static Unit^ eV = gcnew Unit("eV",1.60217646e-19);
00094 
00095         //Time
00096         static Unit^ seconds = gcnew Unit("Seconds",1.0);
00097         static Unit^ nsec = gcnew Unit("nsec",1.0e-9);
00098         static Unit^ mi_sec = gcnew Unit("mi_sec",1.0e-6);
00099 
00100         //Length
00101         static Unit^ metres = gcnew Unit("Metres",1.0);
00102         static Unit^ milimetre = gcnew Unit("Milimetre",1e-3);
00103         static Unit^ micrometre = gcnew Unit("Micrometre",1e-6);
00104         static Unit^ nanometre = gcnew Unit("Nanometre",1e-9);
00105         static Unit^ Angstroms = gcnew Unit("Angstroms",1e-10);
00106         static Unit^ BohrRadius = gcnew Unit("Bohr Radius",52.9177e-12);
00107 };
